conditions.name: Acne Vulgaris
conditions.description: A chronic inflammatory skin condition affecting hair follicles and sebaceous glands, most common in adolescents but can persist into adulthood.
symptoms: Nodules and cysts in severe cases
red_flags: No improvement after 12 weeks of treatment

diagnosis_questions: How long have you had these breakouts?
What treatments have you tried before?
treatment_explanations: Retinoids work by normalizing skin cell turnover - expect some initial dryness
Benzoyl peroxide kills acne bacteria but may bleach fabrics
Oral antibiotics typically show improvement in 4-8 weeks
reassurance: Acne is very common and treatable - let's find the right approach for you
Many effective options exist, even for stubborn acne

conditions.name: Atopic Dermatitis
conditions.description: Chronic, relapsing inflammatory skin disease characterized by intense pruritus and eczematous lesions, often associated with personal/family history of atopy.
symptoms: Common locations: flexural surfaces, face (especially in children)

diagnosis_questions: When did the itching first begin?
Does anyone in your family have allergies or asthma?
What makes the itching better or worse?
Have you noticed any patterns with seasons/environments?
treatment_explanations: Topical steroids should be applied in a thin layer - we'll discuss the right potency for your case
Moisturizers work best when applied to damp skin within 3 minutes after bathing
Biologics like dupilumab target specific immune pathways with good safety profiles
reassurance: While eczema can't be cured, most cases can be well-controlled
Many children outgrow eczema as they get older

ABCDE_of_melanoma.description: Mnemonic for assessing pigmented lesions for melanoma risk

criteria.A: Asymmetry (one half doesn't match the other)
criteria.C: Color variation (shades of brown/black, red, white, blue)
criteria.E: Evolving (changing in size, shape, color, symptoms)

patient_education: When checking moles, remember your ABCDEs - would you like me to explain any letter in more detail?
A changing mole deserves professional evaluation - when did you first notice this change?
clinical_pearls: The 'ugly duckling' sign (a lesion that looks different from others) can be more telling than ABCDE alone
Palmar/plantar/subungual melanomas often present differently than conventional ABCDE patterns

topics.name: Sun Protection
content: Apply 1 oz (shot glass amount) for full body coverage
Reapply every 2 hours or after swimming/sweating
Seek shade during peak UV hours (10am-4pm)
Wear UPF-rated clothing and wide-brimmed hats
conversation_hooks: Many people underapply sunscreen - how much do you typically use?
Did you know UV rays penetrate clouds? Even cloudy days require protection.

topics.name: Skin Self-Exams
content: Pay special attention to sun-exposed areas
Don't forget nails, palms, and soles
conversation_hooks: When was your last thorough skin exam?
Would you like me to walk you through the self-check process?
